title: Ticket #1183: Comments in classad regexes aren't real useful; fix docs.
description:
Our documentation for the regexp classad functions says:
  X or x Ignore both white space and comments within the pattern. A comment is defined by starting with the pound sign (#) character, and continuing until the newline character.
However, you can't practically get a newline into a classad value in Condor. So the comments are useless. We can't simply omit the documentation, since users need to know that they need to escape #. One option is to omit documentation of the "x" option entirely; what's the value if the only thing you can do is add ignored spaces and tabs. (It's more useful if you can add ignored newlines.)
remarks:
2010-Jun-22 10:54:48 by adesmet:
I don't know what I was thinking about the need to escape # marks. You shouldn't need to unless you're using "x", and we don't want users using "x". The documentation in question has been removed, so this is resolved.

2010-Jul-31 11:58:04 by matt:
Alan, what version of the doc was update? Please set the Broken/Fixed version information on the ticket.
